title: Chris Winn
text:
Christopher Elliott Winn (13 November 1926 – 27 August 2017) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player and <a href="cricketer">cricketer</a>. He played international rugby for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> and <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> for <a href="Sussex%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Sussex</a> and <a href="Oxford%20University%20Cricket%20Club">Oxford University</a>.
He died in a nursing home from <a href="pancreatic%20cancer">pancreatic cancer</a> on 27 August 2017.
Rugby.
Winn played eight rugby union <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">Tests</a> for England between 1952 and 1954 as a winger, scoring three tries. He won a <a href="Oxford%20Blue">Blue</a> for <a href="Oxford%20University">Oxford University</a> and after university played for <a href="Rosslyn%20Park%20F.C.">Rosslyn Park</a>, where he was later President.
Cricket.
He appeared in 59 first-class matches as a left-handed <a href="batting%20%28cricket%29">batsman</a> who sometimes <a href="wicketkeeper">kept wicket</a>. He scored 2,449 <a href="run%20%28cricket%29">runs</a> with a highest score of 146 <a href="not%20out">not out</a>, one of two centuries, and completed 40 catches with one stumping.
